INT. ~ PROMOTER‘S OFPICE A mature high-powered promoter sits with four high~ powered executives. Also present is DIXON and L.c.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: ~ The last two pay~per-views lost, and the gate is off 40 percent - : Lc. - ‘Cause all they got is nobody’s out there.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: But we’ve got “human interest” going if we want to run with it.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Rocky Balboa applied and got a license.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it!

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: ~ Hear me out -

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: - Man, I don’t wanna hear it out -

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: It’s an event and it'll sell ~ I’ve got about a couple thousand e-mails attesting to that ~ MASON is stunned. L.c. ~ Hear him out! -

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: ~ Everyone knows what the outcome will be - You can’t lose, but we can capitalize on the novelty - L.c. - That computer fight got people thinkin’.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (eyes L.C. and promoter) You two been talkin’? When were you gonna tell me? L.c. Ain’t nebedy beatin’ that door down for what's out there! There’s no Match-ups out there that people are gonna pay real money for,

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: We got guaranteed fights - L.c. We can't give those damn fights away —- Pay-per-view rejected all of them. With mea names, there's no marquee an’ no money - Think we’re lyin’ here!

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: (to Mason) it's nostalgic man. It’s mostly a has~ been, never-gonna-be’ world, so people will relate to this match up. And as a public relations kicker, you’ll offer a piece of the gate to some charity.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: - Children’s Charity -

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: ‘Children’s Charity’. you'll tap your way to a ten round decision, and the hook is people will see your compassion, while you put on a good show, and don’t destroy this guy. With this new fan base, next fight down the line we’ll double your biggest gate - (to L.c.) If you want a new image, this is the way C to get it. MASON just stares hard at L.Cc. whose anger is rising.  65. L.c. What! What’d I do? I made your world “green” an’ kept you healthy man, that’s what I do and we do. The fighter becomes rigid, MASON looks like he’s about to exit. L.c. (CONT’D) What? I’m lyin’? {to group) Let‘s talk this out. MASON coldly eyes the room and exits. EXT. — ROCKY’S RESTAURANT ~- NIGHT About TWENTY PEOPLE are lined up outside. There is a new energy. INT. - ROCKY’S RESTAURANT — NIGHT The small room is filled to capacity...LIL’ MARIE is hostessing...In the kitchen STEPS is helping prepare food as ROCKY’S in the kitchen, PAULIE knocks on the window and gestures to a worker who taps ROCKY. He steps out into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and ROCKY stands beneath a single rusted lamp fixture that casts sharp shadows in the dark narrow alley. Beside PAULIE is a ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY POUND SIDE OF BEEF wrapped in a gauze cloth. One of PAULIE’S eyes is badly bruised.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (slightly intoxicated) Yo, Rocko ~

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, what happened to ya face?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I punched it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Why?  66.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I needed to.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (calm) Yeah, I’m crazy ~ Hey, I’m bringin’ ya over an old friend ~ Know what this is, Rocko?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: A piece of large meat.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Corn fed steer.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Why’s it here now?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: It’s a gift.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What’s the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I’m celebrating! I retired.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Retired?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: When they start givin’ retirin’ people meat instead of watches?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Cause I gotta watch! You gimme a watch - I don’t need another Goddamn watch!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, Paulie ~ Calm down -

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Why calm down! Calm this down!! PAULIE suddenly grabs an empty TRASH CAN and flings it against the alley wall then kicks it several yards down the alley.  67.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thirty-one friggin’ years, I give ‘em 31 friggin’ years!! My life, £freezgin’! Por what!? My friggin’ life stinks! The more I stir it, more it stinks! Why didn’t I die instead of my sister! I’m the one who oughta be gone!! Me! I’m a liar! I’m the bum! Several people in the kitchen stick their heads out, including MARTE and STEPS. ROCKY waves them back in.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (winded) Y¥‘know — Ya complicate my life - always did.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hey, you’re my friend, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, my nutty-as~a-fruitcake-friend.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Whatta my gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: ROCRY
dialogues.text: Whatta ya wanna do.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Can I move back in the house?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: +..What about ya girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: She wanted rent.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, ya better move back in.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I appreciate this, Rocko. ROCKY nods. PAULIE moves off down the alley. PAULIE (CONT’D) (ealling back) Y'know, it takes guts to climb in that ring knowin’ ya gonna take a beatin’.  68.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: »..Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Yo, Rocko...Can I manage ya?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: There’s nothin’ to really manage.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Stuffin’ in the basement, remember? PAULIE waves and disappears from view. ROCKY grabs the beef and hauls it inside. INT. ~ ROCKY’S RESTAURANT (KITCHEN ) ROCKY enters and drops the massive piece of MEAT on a smaller table. STEPS and the three'Hispanic workers are taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY BALBOA
dialogues.text: You guys wanna split it up ~ Have what ya want. Lil’ MARIE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: Those men over there wanna talk to ya. ROCKY sighs and puts on his blazer. He approaches the table. The three diners are the PROMOTER, L.C.and an executive assistant from his organization. The men rise.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ya doin’? Thanks for comin’ by.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Our pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So wanna hear some fight stories?

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: (smiles ) Fight stories?  69.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Sometimes people like hearin’ old fight stories.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Maybe later ~ I’m Robert Brown - These are my associates Carl Davis and L.c. - We'd like to talk to you a minute. Join us?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (sits) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: We've heard you've gotten your licence back.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that happened.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Congratulations...We have the promotional contract for Mason Dixon - Dixon's a fan, and when he heard you‘re interested in fighting again, he thought why not try to work something out.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: A fight - A title fight, c’mon. L.c. No, a Special Event - like an exhibition fight.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I was thinkin' less large - Smaller.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: Y'know, nothin’ you do is going to be small-time - The press’ll always be around. Technically, you never lost the belt in the ring. You retired, so ina sense you're both Champions, and you're both at a point in your lives where you want to do interesting things and this would be yery interesting.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Gettin’ killed ain't that interestin’.  70.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: It’s an exhibition ~ A glorified sparring session ~ With a portion of the gate going to charity.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So is this thing ain’t a joke.

dialogues.speaker: PROMOTER
dialogues.text: it’s as real as you want to make it. ¥

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m very rusty - L.c. Put it this way, you‘ll have some new stories to tell. ROCKY ponders this as the scene fades.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: The impressive elevated dais is backed by FLOOR-TO- CEILING POSTERS proclaiming the theme of the CHAMPIONSHIP EVENT. Behind the fighters the BANNERS read LIVE PAY PER VIEW - THE DATE - And the HOTEL FIGHT SITE.

dialogues.speaker: SKILL VS. WILE
dialogues.text: ROCKY is seated on the dais looking quite uncomfortable. He is flanked by DUKE, PAULIE and STEPS, Steps cannot believe he’s in such a surrounding. In front of him appears to be an ocean of reporters and glaring video cameras. On the OPPOSITE SIDE of the dais is MASON and COMPANY. With their MATCHING HARD-CORE TEAM APPAREL, they present a unified and intimidating image. In front of the fighters is a very large grouping of REPORTERS backed by a wall of mini-cams. Seated in the center of the dais is the PROMOTER. CUT To:  71. INT. LUCKY’S BAR. NIGHT. ANDY and several of the drinking patrons watch the televison over the bar.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: A few great fighters have fought in their fifties, often with disastrous results — why risk the danger and embarrassment? The smart money says you virtually have no chance.

dialogues.speaker: DURE
dialogues.text: A puncher always has a chance - when Rocky asked me to come on board I did because I believe this can be competitive otherwise I wonldn’t be here. REPORTER: #4 > APs With such a long layoff do you still feel competitive? Energetic?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: (to patrons) --+-He used to sit on that stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT JR sits with all his friends as they observed the interview on a large screen...The small establishment has 30 patrons present. ROBERT JR is visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: You fought a lot of serious fighters. Who do you rate the best?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: To me Creed was the best that ever breathed.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rocky - With all the ‘ring rust,’ how do you think you’ll hold up against Dixon?  72.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Well, ya really don’t know a person's personality ‘til ya punch ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rocky, the press has labeled you a "Balboasaurus” who should be in a museum — Your thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I always liked museums.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Mason, let’s say the following happens - You win, we’ll say you beat an old guy, you lose, say a thumb in the eye, you’ll be the joke of the decade.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That's science fiction. No chance of that! (to Rocky) You were someone once, a good example for the sport - But I’ve never been cut, never been shook up, never waivered — Nobody really touched me on the face hard, so it ‘s going to be kinda hard to convince anyone in America, or the world, that a man like you could present any problems ~

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Anything is possible -— The patrons cheer. Robert Jr cringes.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Again that’s science fiction type thinking. (to Rocky) tet me say this, I’m not a fan of guys comin’ back when their glory’s gone, but you want it you got it. What you’re doin’ ain’t my business, but people better be careful what they wish for. ROBERT JR rises and quickly exits the establishment cur TO:  73. INT. ROCKY’S RESTAURANT. ROBERT enters and sees PAULIE at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Oh, lock who’s here? ROBERT GR. How you doin’ Uncle Paulie ~ Is he here?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (points to the kitchen) In there somewhere. ROBERT moves across the half filled room and enters the kitchen where he sees his father staring at a pot.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hey, How ya doin’? Great ya come by. ROBERT JR. Can I talk with you? £ ROCKY , Sure. ROBERT JR. Can we do it outside?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ALLEY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: ROBERT JR and ROCKY step into the cold night air...ROBERT trys, collects himself, it’s not working. ROBERT JR. You’re going though with this?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Start training tomorrow. ROBERT JR. Nervous about it?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah - Sure ROBERT JR. Then why do it?  7A.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I dunno - Feelin’ somethin’ is better than feelin’ nothin’. ROBERT GR. ¥’know livin’ with you hasn’t been easy. People see me, but they think of you. Now with this thing going on, it’s going to be worse than ever.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Don’t have to be ROBERT JR. Sure it does!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No, it don’t, you got a lot going. ROBERT JR. What? My last name? That’s why I gota decent job, why people even deal with me -— Now I start to get a little ahead, a little something for myself, and this happens - I’m asking you as a favor not to go through with this. It can only end up bad for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I’m hurtin’ you? ROBERT JR. In a way, yes!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Never wanted to do that. ROBERT JR. Maybe, but you are. Don’t you care what other people think? Doesn’t it bother you when they’re making you out to be a joke and I'll be included. Think that’s right?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Y'know, ya won’t believe this - You used to fit in one of my hands, ya did. I'd hold you up and say to your mother, “This kid is gonna be better than any kid in the world. This kid’s gonna be somebody better than anybody I ever knew. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He‘s gonna grow up an’ be smart and tough and never have nobody make‘im feel small - An’ you grew up good and wonderful, made us proud everyday just lookin’ at ya - It was great - An’ the time come for you to be ya own man an’ take on the world. Your world, an’ you did, but somewhere along the line ya changed. Ya stop being you, ya quit fightin’, ya rolled over an’ became a punchin’ bag, not a puncher. Ya let ya world get to ya! Ya started makin’ excuses when things got hard. Ya got afraid to get in there and mix it up with the competition, and ya looked for somethin’ to blame. Like, what'd ya call it? - My shadow ~ let me tell ya somethin’, its a rough very mean world, it punches hard an ya gotta punch back or roll over. You got no choice how you come an, but its your choice how you go out. If ya know what your worth, then go out and get what your worth, but don’t be pointin’ fingers an’ say ya ain’t where ya wanna be ‘cause of him or her. Cowards do that, not men. I love ya no matter what. Ya the best part of my life, but you gotta believe in yaself or you ain’t gonna have no life!...Don’t forget to visit your mother. ROCKY pats his sons arm and goes back in the restaurant. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: ROCKY is in the ring sparring with an opponent who resembles MASON DIXON. PAULIE is there, likewise STEPS who stands alongside DUKE.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Throw that hook off the pivot! Transfer! Go through him - That's it! Leave nothing on the table. ROCKY throws again and is caught with a sizzling combination and Rocky is stung - Duke and Paulie become alerted.  76. DUKE (CONT‘’D) Too much distance - I want you closer than his skin... ROCKY drives forward and is caught with a four punch gombo sets him back en his heels.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time - That’s it - Good. ROCKY exhaustedly steps out of the ring. DUKE (CONT’D) Look, its your first day back an your rusty. Tomorrow we're gonna change strategies - we gonna approach this training a whole different way.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: “ What way?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Real different - We’ll talk about it tomorrow. Shower up. ROCKY moves off and PAULIE slides next to DUKE. MARIE watches from the bench.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: He’s thinkin’ instead of doin’ -~

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Whatta ya gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: He’s got to deal with it. ROCKY wearily moves off towards the locker room. PAULIE is lost in thought. cuT TO:

EXT. — CEMETERY -— DAY ROBERT JR. walks towards the grave site. Up ahead he sees the familiar outline of his father. He places the flowers in his hand on his mother’s grave. ROBERT JR. I really miss her.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (softly) Yeah. Get off work early? ROBERT JR. I quit

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Why? ROBERT JR. Right now I'd rather be with you - That alright?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (touched) ++-Yeah, thanks. They hug with affection. ROBERT UR. ---Been a long time since I’ve seen a fight.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I know where one’s takin’ place. Father and son hug and the scene fades. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: ROCKY stands with DUKE, PAULIE, ROBERT and STEPS. The small power-lifting gym is dark and crammed with power lifting equipment. Off to the side stands a muscular power lifter of thirty-five.  78.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You know all there is to know about fightin’ - So there’s no sense us going down that road again! -~ To beat this guy you'll need speed - You don’t have it. Won’t be feints you’ll call on, or £ootwork or any of that stuff, what we'll be callin’ on is good old fashioned BLUNT FORCE TRAUMA. Why? ‘Cause the law of physics says so. In other words, whatever you hit has got to rattle this man’s bones. Whenever you punch him, his ancestors have to be yelling for mercy. Whenever you land a shot, it will cause unnatural disaster - Let’s start buildin’ some bombs!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE GYM HE IS PUT THROUGH DIFFICULT MANEUVERS DESIGNED
dialogues.text: TO INCREASE EXPLOSIVE POWER IN STRENGTH. It’s GRUELING AND BRUTAL TO WATCH. This training is CROSS-CUT with MASON DIXON’S gym workout which consists of Standard ROPE, HEAVY BAG, SPEED BAG, SPARRING, SHADOW BOXING and MITTS. ROCKY is running at night down the Ben Franklin Parkway. DIXON'S workout increases in tempo and aggressiveness, so does ROCKY’S runs towards the MUSEUM STEPS until finally arriving at the top and jutting his fist triumphantly in the air.

dialogues.speaker: PROVIDE A PATCHWORK QUILT OF THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA. HE
dialogues.text: Is READY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HUGE MARQUEE LETTERS advertising the grand event are being put in place.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: The STAGING CREW is hard at work arranging the lighting. ROCKY enters with ROBERT from the rear of the arena.
ROCKY eyes four men sitting in the bleachers together...He approaches. Mason Dixon steps forward to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Yeah - This place is gonna be full tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Whatever insults were thrown in your way - that was business.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Business is business.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That’s not me. Know what I‘m sayin’? We both know this ain’t no real fight an’ I don’t want nobody gettin’ hurt — I want you to know that.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: So ya not gonna be tryin’ hard?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: T’ll do enough to get ya through it. Nobody has to lose face, you'll be goin’ home in one piece, and that'll be it - But if you try to unload on me, I’m gonna fire hard on you, an’ don’t wanna that. ROBERT JR is awed by the headgame being played.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Ya know, Mason, most people come to Vegas to lose, I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: But you are.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, so ya not scared a little?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Man, I don’t get scared.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Okay - See ya soon. (to Robert Jr) ¥’know - I think ya try harder when yaa little scared. ROCKY and ROBERT JR turn and move off. INT. - ARENA — NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: FILTERING INTO THEIR FRONT ROW SEATS.
dialogues.text: CcuUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: RINGSIDE COMMENTATORS
dialogues.text: The three commentators this evening sit in their satorial splendor before a bank of monitors. One commentator is none other than former world champion, CLUBBER LANG.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Good evening, I’m Jim Langley, with Brent Foster, coming live from the MGM Grand Hotel, Las Vegas. Joining us for this evening’s commentary is a man who certainly knows his way around the ving. Former heavyweight champion Clubber Lang.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: (smiles) Good to be here with you fine gentlemen this evening. INT. ~ ROCKY’S DRESSING ROOM ROCKY’S hands are being taped as PAULIE and ROBERT JR are wearing team uniforms. Cutman LITTLE MIKE is also there. ROBERT JR. nervously paces. The mood is subdued.

INT. - MASON’S DRESSING ROOM This is a stark contrast to ROCKY’S. A boom box is pumping with brain-numbing music. MASON stands in front of a mirror pulsating to the rhythm. He is psyching.-10 people, pilus his 4 corner people are present. There’s a Baptist minister also present. INT. ~ LUCKY’S BAR — NIGHT ANDY and the usual crowd of drinkers are lined up against the bar as they watch the broadcast. PATHER CARMINE enters and takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: How you doin’, Father?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER CARMINE
dialogues.text: My cable’s out...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. —- ARENA ~- RINGSIDE COMMENTATORS

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Much has been said about this being a waltz in the park for Champion Dixon, with little expectation for the well-past prime Champ Rocky Balboa. INT. - ROCKY‘S DRESSING ROOM ROCKY’S gloves are being tied up. INT. -— MASON’S DRESSING ROOM MASON’S gloves are being pulled on at the same moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commentators are standing behind one of the ring posts. EACH IS HOLDING A MICROPHONE.  82.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Even though this is more of a glorified sparring session, the energy in this room is palpable. The sold-out crowd is anxiously awaiting the most curious match- up in years. The flashy Champion, Mason “Dont Cross The Line” Dixon, a powerhouse in every sense of the word will be up against the ancient Philadelphia Champion, Rocky Balboa, in a battle that has been dubbed “The Rage against the Age.”

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. - ROCKY’S DRESSING ROOM ROCKY kneels and prays alone. ROBERT JR. stands in the background. , os

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. — MASON’S DRESSING ROOM MASON’S group is in the main dressing room. L.c. is with him in an adjoining locker room. cuT TO: INT. - ROCKY’S DRESSING ROOM ROCKY is still praying. The sounds of the arena filter into the room.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Nearly all of the seats are filled as we are moments away from tonight’s carnival extravaganza, if I can call it that -

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: What else would you call with it, with Balboa being a 38 to 1 underdog, some may call it a suicide mission. And they might be right. Clubber, your opinion?

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Who's Dixon fought? This is not about money - This will be a fight - This is about pride an’ dignity - This is about who he is.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: So your prediction?

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: When you're gettin’ hit upside your head there can only be one prediction.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Remind us.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: »- PAIN.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. - ROCKY’S DRESSING ROOM ROCKY is all alone in the adjoining room praying.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (entering) +--It’s time. ROCKY nods and rises, ROBERT JR. comes in. ROBERT JR. Ready Rocko?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: «+-Yeah. ROBERT JR. removes a small picture of ADRIAN. ROCKY is touched and folds it and slips it into his sock... ROBERT JR. You’ll be great.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Hope ya Right. INT. - MASON’S DRESSING ROOM The music is thumping with FERAL INTENSITY as MASON prepares to exit his room followed by his ENTOURAGE.  84. Lc. ++-It’s time to bring it! It’s time to cross THE LINE! The rest of the entourage starts to chime in with ad libs. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: The arena is thundering as ROCKY makes his way down the hall with DUKE, ROBERT JR, LITTLE MIKE, PAULIE and STEPS. A group of eight SECURITY MEN in matching dress lead the way. Portable television cameras mounted with sunguns follow ROCKY. The hallways outside the dressing rooms are lit by glaring lights mounted on stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about getting to the ring?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (insulted) Yeah - What’s so complicated? ROCKY’S heart pounds with anticipation. He feels A HAND delicately touch and embrace his arm. Turning to his side, he sees the VISION OF ADRIAN. She faces straight ahead, a portrait of security and confidence. For the first time in a long while ROCKY’S eyes glow with inner peace.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Well, here go the lights ~ We're moments away from the former champion and Reigning Champion making their way into the ring!

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: MASON DIXON and company move towards the arena L.c. You got more people catchin’ you tonight than you ever had -  85. MASON tries to ignore this banter. L.c. (contT’D) If you have to put this man out of his misery, don’t be too savage, be quick. Carry him as long as you can!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. — RING ANNOUNCERS As always, they are seated in front of their monitors.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Get ready for the Mason Dixon Circus to begin! What happened to just walking in, disrobing and doing your job?

dialogues.speaker: COMMNTATOR JIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Boxing has crossbred with showbiz - And it’s now Boxbiz. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: RINGSTDE
dialogues.text: We see the PROMOTER. His wife and TWO BUSINESS partners settle into their seats.

dialogues.speaker: MARIE
dialogues.text: She settles into her seat behind ROCKY’S corner.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. -— ENTRANCE WAY - NIGHT ROCKY and COMPANY stop at a stairway leading to a ramp that will descend into the arena.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: What’s this? ROBERT JR. Ya said you knew.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Watch your step - You’ll follow the ramp down when the music starts.

dialogues.speaker: DURE
dialogues.text: What’s all this? ROCKY is confused and climbs the steps.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I like the regular walkin’ better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASON and Company arrive at the elevated, curtained-off entrance. The arena is thundering with the constant BODY- RATTLING SINGLE DRUM BEAT. People clap along with its droning rhythm... MASON looks distant. L.c. Time to party - (into a walkie-talkie) Start it up!

dialogues.speaker: CUP TO
dialogues.text: ROCKY’S ENTRANCE ROCKY and Company stand nervously on the entrance platform.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I prayed last night - First time.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What ya pray for?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: If ya don’t end up a complete vegetable.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Appreciate it, Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light drops out and the sudden explosion of CLASSICAL/HIP-HOP MIX MUSIC rocks the arena like a sensory jarring earthquake! THE SHOW IS ON! BANG! An array of raking laser lights rip across the audience.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: ROCKY and Company are taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: What the hell’s going on! Suddenly the curtain is ripped open and ROCKY is standing in front of A GIANT BULLS EYE MADE OF TRANSLUCENT PAPER, Colored lights rack wildly across the other side,

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Go Gol

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Where! ?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Go - through it!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MASON’S ENTRANCE MASON DIXON rips through the BULLS EYE on his side of the arena and the effects and music kick into high gear..

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: From the other side of the translucent target we see a POCKET KNIFE slit the huge target and ROCKY appears.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (folding his pocket knife) Go ahead, Rocko. ROBERT, JR. looks at his uncle and shakes his head in wonderment.  88. Awkwardly, ROCKY enters the lighted area and SMOKE BOMBS go off on either side of him. He’s totally startled.

dialogues.speaker: MASSIVE VIEWING ROOM
dialogues.text: At each end of the arena hangs a HUGE SCREEN that will televise both MASON and ROCKY journey into the ring. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: MASON DIXON
dialogues.text: He moves forward looking proud. He glances at the giant viewing screen and sees ROCKY moving toward the ring looking totally befuddled by all the excessive pageantry.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He pulls his son beside him and puts his hands on his shoulders. ROBERT JR. How ya doin’?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Kinda nervous - normal stuff. ROBERT JR. This is amazin’.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah it is. As they approach the ring, SPARKS rain down from all four corners of the OVERHEAD LIGHTING GRID. ROCKY glances up at the viewing screen and observes MASON’S stern entourage approaching.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Here comes Rocky Balboa, veteran of so Many wars - The last hurrah!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Or the last supper with him as the main course.  89.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: In the old days, Balboa was known for his hook to the body - Why was it so much more effective than the other guys? ROCKY remains serene and focused on the job at hand.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: +..’Cause he believed in it, when you believe in a certain punch, or anythin’ - You’re better at it - That’s all there is to it. ROCKY touches THE HANDS THAT EXTEND into the aisle-way. A slight SMILE TRACES ACROSS HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Look at the Stallion! - He looks cool - Very relaxed! - He’s gonna bring it.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: You saying he won’t be intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Bon‘t be a fool - How you ever gonna “intimidate” him after he’s been in there with a monster like me! The crowd cheers loudly as ROCKY enters the ring and waves. The ring and corner posts are covered with sponsor logos (example Budweiser, Hotel site). A moment later MASON DIXON and company climbs the steps into the ring. He dances around as his group holds up his belts.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Mason’s management must be enjoying the excitement. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Considering the last four fights have been half sold out, truly dull affairs.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: When the bell rings I have a feelin’ this will.be another one too. ROCKY is getting his bearings as DUKE, PAULIE, STEPS and ROBERT JR. flank him. He glances ringside and sees CLUBBER wearing headphones.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Is that Clubber?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Believe so.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He has the same hair.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Clubber, you fought him twice, what‘’s your most vivid recollection?

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Wakin’ up ~ Lose teeth. ROCKY, still in his robe, is pacing in his corner, getting more focused. Clubber glances over at ROCKY and waves.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Why's he smilin’ so much?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Heard he found God.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: That’1ll do it. The BELL RINGS and the RING ANNOUNCER steps to the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASON’S CORNER L.C. is seen leaning back over the ropes in MASON’S CORNER as he exchanges words with the promoter’s business associate. L.C. Comes up beside MASON. Lc The pay per view has tripled our last show. MASON ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the MGM Grand and a night of heavyweight excitement - without further ado, a man that needs no introduction, weighing in at a solid 215 pounds, a two-time champion with a colorful record of 79 wins, 69 by knock-out, against 23 losses and one draw - let's have a big warm welcome to “the Italian Stallion,” Rocky Balboa! The ROCKY FANS GO WILD as the fighter shyly nods and raises his fists in acknowledgement.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Balboa’s 15 pounds heavier than his maximum. That’s not a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Hailing from Las Vegas, (huge roar) Weighing 221 pounds, with a flawless record of 22 and 0, with 20 knock-outs, the present, undisputed heavyweight champion of the world, a man who has been dubbed, “the bottom line,” Mason “The Line” Dixon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MASON’S LEGION OF YOUNGER FANS leap to their feet with unabashed adulation. cur TO: INT. - LUCKY’S BAR The patron's enthusiasm mounts as they yell out encouraging quotes to their home town hero.

dialogues.speaker: ARENA
dialogues.text: The Arena is literally pulsating as SPECTATORS STOMP their feet and cheer for the battle to commence. MASON DIXON is the first the disrobe and is in EXTRAORDINARY CONDITION.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: As expected, the Champion looks awesome. Nothing like having great genetics, folks. He looks ready to go to work and go home early. ROCKY disrobes and much to people's surprise is also in wonderful condition.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Balboa also looks in good condition ~ But you can’t put muscle on a chin.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Man, you guys don’t give nobody a break! Get your knife an’ fork ‘cause you’ll be eatin’ your words!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: To balance out this reporting the ‘rap’ on Dixon is he really has never been pushed. A lotta fighters can only be judged by the competition and he’s had none.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: But technically he's incredibly sound.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: For sure.
ROCKY’S CORNER ROCKY stands flanked by his son. The REFEREE waves the fighters forward.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: Fighters over here. ROCKY turns and kisses his SON.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: --.I’m very glad you’re here. Tears nearly well in ROBERT’S eyes as he and his father moves to the CENTER of the ring. CENTER OF THE RING.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: You both have been here before - no low blows, no kidney punches, break when I tell you. They are about to touch gloves and Mason leans close to ROCKY. When he speaks it’s NOT IN THE LEAST WAY DEMEANING.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Enjoy the ride.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: .eeI71l try.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Gimme ya best.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Looks like these two were havin’ a little conference.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I think the champion was asking Balboa if he has a signed Will.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: We'll see, Brother, we'll see — You're too negative young man -  94.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Since Rocky has moved over to the mature side of boxing, let’s hope his corner’s devised a plan to take the youthful bounce out of his opponent. INT. - ROCKY’S CORNER DUKE slips in ROCKY’S mouthpiece. ROCKY glances back at MARIE and nods.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: We got three rounds to establish a tempo - Everything you throw has got to leave a dent.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Go get ‘em, Rocko. ROBERT JR. Smack this chump. ROCKY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Both parties look anxious to get at each other; there’s the bell and this fight is underway! ROCKY rushes to the center of the ring and likewise, MASON DIXON. At the last second MASON CUTS SHARPLY to his left with ROCKY in hot pursuit. ROCKY tries to unload a right hook and MASON slips it and waves ROCKY forward.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: The fans came to see a fight and instead it's a game a cat and mouse. MASON continues to gracefully avoid ROCKY, while almost handling the man with barely lukewarm jabs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MASON’S CORNER L.c. Show ‘em who's untouchable, baby! We got all night!  95.

dialogues.speaker: RING
dialogues.text: MASON slips out of the corner as ROCKY tries to pin him down. curt TO: ROCKY’S CORNER.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Keep it steady! Pressure on! Pump that jab baby! cur TO: THE RING. MASON continues to dance with ROCKY in hot pursuit. The crowd is quite vociferous in its displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Rocky has quickened his pursuit, but the champion simply increases his back- peddling - Not one telling punch has been connected.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Balboa is showing me somethin’ —

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: That he’s slower than lava?

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: An’ when lava catches you? Toast Brother! The fighters are seen dancing past the ringside commentators. The Champion continues to give the world and ROCKY a brilliant exhibition of foot-work.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Balboa wants to take it to him. But the champ wants to stretch it out, as though he knows he can take the former champ out at any time - Call it a mercy fight. cur TO:

MASON‘S CORNER. .C. leans forward as the fighter dances past. L.c. You're making ‘em look like a damn mummy out there! Keep it goin’! cur TO: LUCKY'S BAR. ANDY and the usual customers appear to be deflated as they witness the boring spectacle.

dialogues.speaker: ANDY
dialogues.text: The “old” Rock would have broke ribs by now.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: ROCKY tries once more to cut off the ring, but again, DIXON slips away.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: The man I’m looking at in the ring is ineffectual and just plain slow —

dialogues.speaker: THE RING.
dialogues.text: ROCKY CURIOUSLY begins to LOWER HIS GUARD which completely EXPOSES his face.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t he just put a welcome mat on his chin that says “Knock me out.”

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: He’s temptin’ him - Settin’ him up! CUT TO;  97. THE RING. The crowd is getting insane at the inactivity. ROCKY now is presenting his face as an IRRESISTIBLE TARGET.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ROCKY’S CORNER ROBERT JR. What’s he doin’?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Usin’ his head!

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: With crowd’s BOOING REACHING HURRICANE INTENSITY, and ROCKY’S guard being held DANGEROUSLY LOW, Mason lashes out with a VICIous JAB, followed by three more that find their mark.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Blinding jabs ~- Oh, what a combination and another! ROCKY is truly being DOMINATED BY YOUTH AND SPEED.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: The Champion is sitting down on his punches a little more now.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: And he’s gettin’ too close to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: He shifts uncomfortably behind ROCKY’S corner. ROBERT JR. C’mon, get ‘im! curt To:  98.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: MASON is in his rhythm and fires another flurry of jabs.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: A total domination. Oh, what a shot!!! MASON releases a vicious combination which ROCKY slips and RIPS A PAIR OF THUNDEROUS BODY PUNCHES.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Now that's what I'm talkin’ about! I love payback ~ warms my soul! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: ROCKY now RAINS A TEN PUNCH COMBO on Mason and drives Dixon against the ropes. MASON TIES HIM UP. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: MASON'S CORNER
dialogues.text: The corner men are frantic. They pound the ring apron.

dialogues.speaker: CORNER MAN
dialogues.text: Tie him up! Tie him up! cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dixon covers up as bomb after bomb rains down on him. MASON tries to slide sideways and ROCKY BULLS HIM INTO THE CORNER.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Get into the hurtin’ business, Rocko! ROCKY fires off a beautiful six-punch combination.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Get ready for some major league damage, people! He’ll be spittin’ bones for a month!
But MASON roars back and POUNDS A TORRENT OF PUNCHES into ROCKY that gets people to their feet. THE BELL RINGS. The crowd goes berserk! ROCKY taps DIXON’S gloves as a token of mutual respect.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Good one. curt To:

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: If Balboa is ever gonna have a chance of surviving this fight, he has to keep up his “shock and awe” style of brawling!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY'S CORNER
dialogues.text: ROCKY chooses TO STAND between rounds. DUKE, PAULIE and ROBERT JR rapidly provide assistance. STEPS stands outside the ring passing up the water.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Real good ~ fine - good. ROBERT JR. That was great.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Thanks he got very long arms

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: See, that’s the way it’s got to go - Hold nothin’ back. Lean on him, pull on him, rough him up, take ‘im to school! You gotta be more active out there. You hurt him - Fight hard, baby! cur TO: MASON’S CORNER THE CHAMPION sits on a stool and eyes Rocky. A COOL TOWEL is applied to his face, he brushes it aside. L.c. Ten seconds of luck! He suckered you in.  100.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Man can hit! L.c. Don't give him too much respect! All he’s tryin’ to do is hit you with a left lead after diggin’ to the body! Do me a favor — Keep workin’ that jab, put a little more speed behind it and keep workin’ those hard lefts to the body! It’s your show! This is what they came for! Don’t end it teo soon!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, I scored that round even!

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Man, beside being stupid, you need glasses!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The crowd is on their feet as the SECOND ROUND COMMENCES. MASON charges forward and unleashes a torrent of jabs and VICIOUS HOOKS TO THE BODY. ROCKY is CAUGHT OFF GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Balboa is once again trying to cut off the fleet-footed Dixon. Jab after jab finds its mark!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Dixon’s beating him in every way. Power punches, boxing, ring generalship. ROCKY lunges at the Champion and nearly stumbles to the canvass.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Balboa’s just getting cut up! cur TO: ROCKY’S CORNER. ROBERT JR. C’mon, you can do it!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Get the hell in there! cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: The arms! Hit ‘im on the joints!

dialogues.speaker: THE RING.
dialogues.text: MASON pounds away. ROCKY tries to tie him up but MASON pulls his arm loose and pounds a couple lefts. Stepping to the center of the ring, DIXON delivers a perfect shot and ROCKY stumbles BACKWARDS AND GOES DOWN TO ONE KNEE. The REFEREE gives the EIGHT COUNT.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Perfectly timed - Perfectly delivered ~ Rocky still looks disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: He'll get up Man's, like a yo-yo!

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY
dialogues.text: +».Get up kid, go after him! INT. - ROCKY’S CORNER

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Tie him up! Breathe! Cover up!  102.

dialogues.speaker: MICKEY, (SPECTRE)
dialogues.text: The body, the body, the body! MASON is waved on and proceeds to hit ROCKY 15 unanswered punches.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: This is looking incredibly one sided. If Rocky ever had any illusions about surviving, they’re going south fast! — Rocky’s hanging in. MASON backs away and hits ROCKY with three stinging jabs and throws a whipping right hook that lands on ROCKY’S hip bone. An INAUDIBLE GASP is heard in the arena as MASON recoils in IMMENSE PAIN!

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Mason’s hands hurt!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: A big right to the body and Mason winces in pain. This could change everything! Here comes Balboa

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: ROCKY moves ahead and soon has MASON backing up from a BOMBARDMENT OF PUNCHES.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Por the first time Mason is in reverse! In desperate trouble, MASON leaps forward and throws five right hooks.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Mason’s in deep water! But he’s fighting back. He hasn’t thrown a left hand since the injury! But there’s a left and the champion grimaces! This is gonna change the fight!

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Balboa's willin’ to take five shots to land one crushing body blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROCKY sets him up with two jabs and with a LEFT UPPER-cUT TO THE LIVER that shakes MASON to his core. THE CROWD LEAPS TO THEIR FEET.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Tf his hand is in fact hurt, in the heat of battle with his blood flowing hot, it'll take a couple of rounds to numb his hand up before he can throw it again. This playing field is now level!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MASON back-peddles. Just as his head is clearing he is caught by another TREMENDOUS BODY SHOT to the liver.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Mason is nearly folded in half with that body shot! ROCKY comes in for the kill and hits three right hooks on the button. MASON courageously throws four straight hooks. COMMENTATOR JIM (CONT’D) Dixon's coming back using just the right hand! He showing great courage as he tries to keep Balboa off of him with jast his right hand!

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: Here it comes! MASON fires a flurry of hooks and a weak right.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Dixon throws seven hooks and he mixes in one painful left hand! The crowd is on its feet! MASON rallies and backs BALBOA up with an amazing combination. ROCKY once again rallies. They are EXCHANGING BLOWS as the bell rings. The referee LEAPS IN AND FRANTICALLY SEPARATES the fighters.

dialogues.speaker: UNBELIEVABLY IN A GESTURE OF RESPECT THEY TAP GLOVES.
dialogues.text: cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: I can’t believe two men can give and take like that, then touch gloves - Listen to the fans! This is what they come for!

dialogues.speaker: CLUBBER
dialogues.text: I told you chumps - Now it’s anybody’s fight! curT TO: ROCKY’S CORNER ROCKY is still standing as Duke works on his scalp cut.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (to Steps) Water here! (to Rocky) You alright?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah - yeah ~ No problem, I’m good - Real good

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Deep breaths! You took his best, you’re in the game. Once again ROCKY looks over at his son and gestures that he’s is fine.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MASON'’S CORNER MASON leans forward onto LC’s shoulder so no one can see what he says.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: C : My hand’ s hurt...  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lc Is it broken?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Don’t think so - It’ll be alright. Le It‘ll numb up. Keep that jab workin’ the next round! Throw the jab and bring the hook to the body! ROCKY’S CORNER

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Stay on it! Everybody thought this was a joke now nobody’s laughin’. You got the power ~ You want it?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: vean! (rising) a ue eah!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Then go get it!

dialogues.speaker: WHAT TRANSPIRES OVER THE NEXT SEVEN ROUNDS IS AN
dialogues.text: EXTRAORDINARY GIVE AND TAKE BETWEEN THE FIGHTERS. The round ends with Rocky being nearly buckled from a PERFECT COMBINATION and exhaustion. ROBERT JR. is awed by his father who he thought he knew. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Everyone's certainly getting their money’s worth here tonight! People might have thought this was a publicity stunt but this is pure Roman-Coliseum time. cur To:  106. LUCKY’S BAR All the patrons are screaming at the screen which has a close-up of ROCKY BALBOA in a slow motion re-enactment of the last round. cur TO: ROCKY’S CORNER ROCKY is on the verge of physical collapse. Now he sits on a stool.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: How much you got left?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: A little — enough. ROCKY turns a battered eye towards Marie and his son.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You wanna call it in? - I’1l1 do what you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: ROCRY
dialogues.text: What! Don’t say that - I’m here! Mouthpiece!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MASON’S CORNER Mason rises at the warning buzzer. L.c. Whatever you got, get it! Whatever you gotta do, do it! Whatever you got left, you put it in his face! Dominate - Dominate!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ROCKY’S CORNER Duke slips in Rocky’s mouthpiece.  107.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: +-+-There’s nothing more I can tell you, a lotta people that love you no matter what happens - Go get it! ROCKY nods at DUKE and catches PAULIE and STEPS eyes. He’s very touched by the sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: The bell sounds. The two fighters step to the center of the ring and touch gloves.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: ++.You still here? ler os ROCKY Absolutely - MASON starts to survey things up and FIRES THREE HARD but still effective jabs into ROCKY’S face.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: The Champion is applying pressure which at this point is enough to keep Balboa at bay.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Balboa is completely depleted - Both are. cur To: ROCKY continues to move ahead, dodging punches whenever he can. Throwing CAUTION TO THE WIND, he charges.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Balboa’s appears totally content to end this battle on his feet - The chants of “ROCKY” are building. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Just when you thought you saw everythin’ Balboa’s down!

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR BRENT
dialogues.text: Fighting with an injured hand, Dixon has mustered the courage and strength and floored the exhausted Philly brawler! cur To: MARIE is on her feet. ROBERT goes directly behind DUKE. ROBERT JR. You wanna stop this - He did enough!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: He‘d kill me - Get up my man! Get up! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: ARENA
dialogues.text: The entire FIGHT CROWD is on its feet going completely berserk.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Rocky’s up! He seems determined to end this fight on his feet, while Dixon is showing more heart than anyone gave him credit for! ROCKY drives hard into MASON and pins him against the rope.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE LAST OF HIS STRENGTH, BALBOA DRIVES A SERIES OF
dialogues.text: BLOWS INTO THE CHAMPION’S MID-SECTION. MASON ABSORBS THE

dialogues.speaker: LUNGES BACK JUST AS THE BELL RINGS.
dialogues.text: The two fighters nearly collapsed on one another then slip into an embrace, their foreheads touching.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Good work - Great fight!  109. DUKE, ROBERT JR, and PAULIE comes out and guides ROCKY to the corner. ROCKY (CONT’D) (puts his arm around his son) .--I think I peaked.

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The ring announcer motions for the bell to ring. The ring begins to fill with fight officials and well- wishers. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We have a unanimous decision! cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: RING ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The judge scores 8 to 4, 7 to 5, and 6, to 5 and 1, even, all for the winner Heavyweight Champion, Mason “The Line” Dixon!!! MASON’S CORNER Though battered and bruised he raises his arm in victory then points a CONGRATULATORY FIST TOWARDS ROCKY.

dialogues.speaker: ARENA
dialogues.text: All the fans are still applauding wildly having gotten their money's worth. Ringside COMMENTATOR JIM is in the ring with the CHAMPION and ROCKY BALBOA.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Mason, have you ever been through anything like this?  110.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: No - Respect ya elders if they hit like that.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: You seem to have finally earned the crowds respect tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: (smiles) Amazin’ how people learn to like ya after they've seen ya almost beaten to death.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR JIM
dialogues.text: Rocky - What a war - And still standing. You been through a lotta good opponents - How would you rate this man here?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Lotta guts’’-Maybe the best I was ever in with — MASON hugs ROCKY -

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enjoy it -~ It goes fast.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The scene drifts back across the TWILIGHT horizon of PHILADELPHIA, then dissolves to the tranquil cemetery. In the distance we see ROCKY with his portable chair, arrive at his wife’s grave site, Opening the chair he lowers himself down and studies his beloved wife's HEADSTONE.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yo, Adrian, we did it.
